original:
The Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction event, which occurred approximately 66 million years ago, resulted in the extinction of non-avian dinosaurs. This event allowed mammals to rapidly increase in size and diversity. Mass extinctions can accelerate evolutionary processes by creating opportunities for new groups of organisms to diversify and thrive.



Bacteria are a major domain of prokaryotic microorganisms, typically measuring a few mic
